DataElement.preferredName: Patient Endometrial Malignant Neoplasm Eligibility Determination Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to criteria to determine eligibility of patients based on atypical neoplastic relating to or composed of endometrium.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Endometrial Malignant Neoplasm Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to criteria to determine eligibility of patients based on atypical neoplastic relating to or composed of endometrium.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Relating to or composed of endometrium.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or composed of endometrium.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: If the patient has a synchron
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient has a synchronous primary endometrial cancer or past history of endometrial cancer, is it more advanced than Stage I-B OR with greater than superficial myometrial invasion with vascular or lymphatic invasion OR poorly differentiated subtypes including papillary serous, clear cell or other FIGO Grade 3 lesions

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patent have FIGO 2009 Stage IVB endometrial cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have synchronous primary endometrial cancer or a past history of primary endometrial cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a past history of primary endometrial cancer within the last five years that does not meet the following conditions: Stage not greater than I-B; no more than superficial myometrial invasion; no poorly differentiated subtypes, including papillary serous, clear cell or other FIGO Grade 3 lesions?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have grade 1 or 2 recurrent or metastatic endometrioid endometrial cancer?
